sections.History:
Pixomondo was founded in Pfungstadt, Germany, in 2001 by Thilo Kuther. By 2012, it has grown to include roughly 800 employees operating in a global network of studios in thirteen locations around the world, including Berlin, Frankfurt, Munich, Stuttgart, Hamburg, Munich, London, Baton Rouge, Detroit, Los Angeles, Burbank, Torronto, Beijing, Shanghai, and SĂŁo Paulo. Their overall headquarters remains in Frankfurt.<ref>[http://www.fastcocreate.com/1681718/collaboration-isnt-always-pretty-behind-the-emmy-winning-vfx-for-game-of-thrones?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed:+fastcocreate/feed+%28Co.Create%29#1 Fastcocreate.com] "Collaboration Isnâ€™t Always Prettyâ€”Behind The Emmy-Winning VFX For â€œGame Of Thronesâ€?</ref>

The studio has previously provided CGI and VFX work on films such as ''Sucker Punch'', ''Super 8'', ''Red Tails'', ''Snow White and the Huntsman'', and ''The Hunger Games''. In February 2012, Pixomondo's work as lead VFX studio for the Martin Scorsese film ''Hugo'' won the Academy Award.
